alert.note: Alert for Knox (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 2:12PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Knox County through 245 PM CDT... At 212 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Maquon, or 15 miles southeast of Galesburg, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Knox County. This includes Interstate 74 between mile markers 59 and 63. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
